Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; above, part of elaborate rosette in added white and added red; below, white band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bearded male to left (part of head, neck and shoulder remaining), holding what may be a wreath.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 286, no. 830, pl. III, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1009) (phase 2)
